> NAIF (National Approach for Interoperable repositories and Findable research results) is a Swiss collaboration improving interoperability and metadata quality across institutional repositories.

Use this file as a curated map of the public NAIF website. Prioritise pages under About, News, and Events for project context and current activities.

## Core pages

- [Home](/): Project landing page with latest updates and upcoming events.
- [About](/about.html): Project scope, objectives, tracks, governance, and team.
- [News index](/posts/): Listing of NAIF news posts and progress updates.
- [Events index](/events/): Listing of upcoming and past NAIF events.
- [Publishing guidelines](/publishing-guidelines.html): Public guidance for creating NAIF posts and event entries.

## Data and policy links

- [Zenodo NAIF community](https://zenodo.org/communities/naif): Archived NAIF outputs and project documents.
- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/eth-library/naif): Source code and issue tracker for the website.
- [Disclaimer](/disclaimer.html): Legal notice and data protection links.

## Optional

- [News RSS feed](/posts.xml): Metadata and summaries from recent news entries.
- [Events RSS feed](/events.xml): Metadata and summaries from event entries.
- [Sitemap](/sitemap.xml): Full list of publicly published pages.
